item.title: Public Mutual declares distribution, unit split
item.description:
Public Mutual Bhd

sample image sample texthas declared a gross distribution of five sen per unit to unitholders of the Public Index Fund (PIX). The closing price for the fund’s net asset value (NAV) on Jan 25, 2006 was 79.68 sen per unit.

item.title: IOI declares 30 sen interim dividend
item.description: IOI 2名警員勾Corp Bhd has declared a 60% gross interim dividend or 30 sen per 50 sen share for the year ending June 30, 2006, the company announced on Jan 27.

item.title: KPJ 名騎電單車的印裔青年，然後通過電話向肉票妻子索取 to sell hospital buildings to REIT for RM343.25m
item.description: KPJ 名騎電單車的印裔青年，然後通過電話向肉票妻子索取1000 Healthcare Bhd is selling its entire interests in Ampang Puteri Specialist Hospital building, Damansara Specialist Hospital building, Johor Specialist Hospital building and Seremban Hospital building to KPJ Healthcare Real Estate Investment Trust (REIT) for RM343.25 million.
item.author: Ashwin Raman

item.title: 334 corporate proposals approved last year
item.description: The Securities Commission (SC) approved 64 corporate proposals in the fourth quarter (4Q) of 2005, bringing the total number of corporate proposals approved last year to 334.
item.author: Surin Murugiah

item.title: OSK-UOB's Asia Pacific Fund all sold out again
item.description: OSK-UOB Unit Trust Management Bhd's Asia Pacific Fund’s second application for a further increase of another 200 million units has once again been sold out. The approved fund size now stands at 700 million units.

item.title: HSBC announces new banking hours
item.description: HSBC Bank Malaysia Bhd (HSBC) branches will be open from 9.30am to 4pm, Mondays to Fridays, effective Feb 1, 2006.

item.title: SME Bank was allocated RM1b
item.description: The government has allocated RM1 billion to the newly launched SME Bank to finance the development of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in Malaysia, says Prime Minister Datuk Seri Abdullah Ahmad Badawi.
item.author: Kevin Tan

item.title: Siemens to implement DiGi 3G network system
item.description: DiGi.Com Bhd unit DiGi Telecommunications Sdn Bhd has executed a Letter of Intent (LOI) with Siemens Malaysia Sdn Bhd for the implementation of its third generation (3G) network system.

item.title: TM to sell stake in Telekom Networks Malawi
item.description: Telekom Malaysia Bhd (TM) is selling its entire 60% stake in Telekom Networks Malawi (TNM) to Econet Wireless Global for US$24.5 million (RM91.88 million).

item.title: Nazir made BCHB director
item.description: Datuk Nazir Razak has been appointed a non-independent non-executive director of Bumiputra-Commerce Holdings Bhd (BCHB).

item.title: Ranhill gets Sabah power job
item.description: Ranhill Power Bhd's unit Ranhill Tuaran Sdn Bhd has been awarded a 190 MW gas fired power project in Kota Kinabalu by the Economic Planning Unit of the Prime Minister’s department.

item.title: Volkswagen breaks silence on Proton deal
item.description: Senior Volkswagen executives met up with a small group of Malaysian journalists recently to explain the current status of its relationship with Proton Holdings Bhd, several weeks after its chairman Bernd Pischetsrieder said at the Detroit Motor Show that it would not be going ahead with its purchase of Proton shares.
item.author: Jason Tan

item.title: Proton, VW agree to cooperate on specific projects
item.description: Proton Holdings Bhd and Volkswagen AG are proceeding to cooperate on specific projects that include the supply of products and components by the German auto maker to the national carmaker.

item.title: Focus Dynamics' 2m shares public issue oversubscribed 59.4 times
item.description: Sumatec Bhd's public issue of two million shares have been oversubscribed 59.4 times following the ballotting exercise.

item.title: Kulim to sell Sumatra plantations for RM225m
item.description: Kulim (Malaysia) Bhd is divesting its palm oil plantations in Sumatra for US$60 million (RM225 million) to concentrate on building up its larger operation in central Kalimantan, in a move to consolidate its Indonesian operations.
